issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

projectCategory.description: Titanium and related SDKs used in application development
projectCategory.name: Client

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:
In KitchenSink, go to:
Phone tab > Geolocation

Back out until you exit the application, then wait a few seconds and you should see an NDK crash in logcat. Note that this crash isn't reported to the user.
{code}

E/TiBaseActivity(32310): (main) [4,53362] Layout cleanup.

fields.summary: Android: KitchenSink silent crash on exit when using the Geolocation test

comments.body:
This crash appears to be caused by a sensor event ('heading') that is being fired after
the runtime has been disposed. While we do register for the destroy event on the current
activity this doesn't appear to stop the sensor in time. This is probably due to sensor
events being dispatched from their own thread onto the runtime thread message queue. So while we fire
a synchronous event "destroy" for the activity on the UI thread, this won't stop the sensor thread from
pushing new messages onto the runtime queue in the mean time.

We may need a way to halt sensors before we start the disposal of the runtime.
Also we need to be careful in other parts of the platform to always "stop" event sources
when a disposal is about to begin. So a more general API to register a callback for "dispose" may
be the best solution.
Sent [Pull Request #1690|https://github.com/appcelerator/titanium_mobile/pull/1690] to address this issue.

I'm still seeing a hard crash after Geo, here's another log (looks like this might be related to the reverse geo event)
